website_summaries.verdict: Uses the perfect mix of foam and abrasion-resistant fabrics to protect your arms for a variety of activities.
pros: Reasonable price point for a pair of forearm guards
Padding is well positioned to keep the forearm safe
Has enough flexibility in the fabric and padding to allow freedom of movement for many types of sports
cons: Some people won’t like that it slides over the elbow too

customer_reviews.title: Great for a toddler who needs to crawl instead of walk
customer_reviews.text: tta Duckett-Freeman So I am so excited. These elbow pads came in the mail and they are perfect for my daughtef. She is 3 and has Spina Bifida and is paralyzed from her waist down in various areas. So we don’t allow her to crawl outside because her legs bleed and then we have to worry about infections. We bought the small elbow protection pads for her legs and now she has tons of protection!
customer_reviews.author: Claretta

customer_reviews.title: These pads are bad at padding
customer_reviews.text: These pads are super comfortable and until you need the padding part, at which point they slide right up your arms. So if you're not planning on crashing and you just want comfortable elbow pads these are great. If you actually need pads that might protect you in the event of a crash, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S.

customer_reviews.title: Moved on fall, did not protect
customer_reviews.text: Product fit well and snug, however when I needed them most at a downhill park today, they slid up and now i have a nice hole in my elbow from the trail. I measured and went by the chart for size, just slid right up and got gouged. Would not recommend. I will be looking into a name brand alternative that is trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order a size down
customer_reviews.text: Recommendation- Order a size down. I am a 24 year old female athletic/medium build with smaller arms and medium was too large.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for caving; meets expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use while caving to protect my elbows and forearms while crawling through tight passage and breakdown. I’ve used them multiple times and they have performed as well as I could have hoped and provide the protection I need. I’ve used while crawling through mud, rock, and water and I hose them off and hang them up for the next trip. I am a 5’11” man and weigh ~175 lb and I bought them in medium. I wanted a snug fit to help prevent as much unintentional slipping down my arm and they fit pretty snug, but aren’t so tight as to cut off circulation. The price on these is unbeatable for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun R.

customer_reviews.title: Runs crazy big
customer_reviews.text: They are not small. The small (which I purchased for my son) fit my 5'11" 300 # husband. So, keep that in mind if ordering for a child. That being said, the quality is quite good. These would have been the perfect arm guard for my son if they would have stayed on.
customer_reviews.author: fmedic5

customer_reviews.title: Elbow pads anyone?
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 pairs of these for a High School Foot Ball team. They play on Turf which causes burns. These are lightly padded - not bulky but don't let their thin light appearance fool you. These provide great - excellent protection from contact with helmets, tackles and slides on turf. The material and workman ship are excellent. So far they are holding up well to heavy use. (2) Large (1) Med I mountain bike as well - plan to use them on a few local rides but hopefully won't test them out!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bear

customer_reviews.title: Get something a little better
customer_reviews.text: How to change my view on these. When I first got them they made me feel very safe and secure but that was cuz I haven't fell on them yet. I fell with them today errand I did not get as bad of cuts as I did without them but they still protect me like they should have
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted! My elbow was shattered 11 months ago and now has “hardware” installed. (Pins, plates, screws and a bolt.). This made it too painful to compete in a tactical sport that I love. This pad was perfect. Perfect fit, perfect size and perfect flexibility. I still had pain (that’s to be expected) but at least I was able to participate. Oh, and I won first place! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Louis P Kadubic III

customer_reviews.title: Great Elbow Pads!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to provide a bit of protection for my elbow when I was having an odd nerve issue with one of them. If I'd get pressure in a certain spot I'd have a stabbing/burning sensation on the tip of my elbow. Not very comfortable. I got these after seeing that a fellow grappler rated them decently high. He was right. These things really do work well. They stay in place and don't slide down your arm as easy as others that I've tried. The amount of padding and protection is great! I'd just make sure to order a size smaller than you think you are. I did and they fit great! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: babb4214

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for skating or impact
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I cannot recommend these for skating. I used these for rollerskating around the neighborhood, thinking that I didn't need anything too bulky, as I don't do roller derby or skate parks. The first time I wore these, I took a spill and broke my elbow! The padding is just not sufficient to protect from hard impacts. On the other hand, they really aren't meant for that. They are more for preventing scrapes and bruises. And they are pretty comfortable and don't restrict movement. I'll probably wear them over some g-force elbow pads so I have more impact protection, as well.
customer_reviews.author: r0r0b0t

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these elbow pads
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these elbow pads, because my skin is so thin, I easily bruise and rupture my elbows. These incidents occur especially when getting into or out of cars and SUVs, and at restaurants. I used one of my elbow pads yesterday to overcome my usual hazards. I want to thank you for this product. It will save me from the bruises and tears that have usually occurred. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: Lynden C. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: These elbow pads are exactly what I was hoping to find. Light and unobtrusive enough that I can forget I am wearing them, particularly under a shirt. And the padding seems to do a great job of protecting my elbow. I'm using it to prevent pain from and further aggravation to bursitis in the elbow. I read so many blah reviews of elbow pads that I really had low expectations despite these looking like the best of the lot. As my headline says, these greatly exceeded expectations and I am happy to have found them.
customer_reviews.author: MacViking

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my ankle and had to hop around and crawl up the stairs. My shoulder is too messed up to use crutches. So after I slammed my forearm into the a stair and thought I broke it I purchased these for protection. THey are working great for me. I can imagine that their actual use would work great for others too. Just so glad to have protection while I crawl and fall for the next 5 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Devin S

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: My purpose may not be the exact purpose that most people will use it for. I hurt the bone between my elbow and bicep (sorry, I am not a doctor, so I don't know what it's called). Every single day, I bang it either by walking into a room too close to the door and banging it into a corner wall. I'm a doofus. So, I figured I need some padding in that area so that I am protected from my moronic maneuvers. THis does the trick. I even tried to bang into the wall at the same speed as I I accidentally do and felt nothing. Woo-hoo, I'm all set.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: Best found on the market with a couple of caveats
customer_reviews.text: Am a serious martial arts practitioner who was getting my arms pretty banged up. Protection textured part on these a little thick - good for punching bags, may graze your sparring partner. Fabric sleeve a little thick and not so not so forgiving or flexible when bending arm. So when bending arm can be a little uncomfortable, especially if you start to work a sweat.Wish they ran one size smaller for slimmer customers. Wish they used alternate fabric for sleeve that doesn't wrinkle and Best I found on the market
customer_reviews.author: aNon

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Excellent fit
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 feet 10 inch and 200 pounds. The measurement around my elbow is 12 inches so I was in between 2 sizes. I ordered Large and the elbow pads fit me just right. Not too tight or too loose. It feels very comfortable and the material looks like of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adam East

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mountain Biking and Low Price!
customer_reviews.text: Short and Sweet... Pros: -They stay on the entire activity -They offer plenty of protection -lightweight and breathable -can't even tell they are there! Cons: Need to be aired out in a well ventilated space for those who sweat like Florida like me. They stay pretty wet unless you do the aforementioned. Conclusion: I use them for mountain biking and they meet all my requirements for comfort, practicality, and safety. I really love these pads. My TLD Raid knee pads were 4x the cost of these and don't work any better than these Bodyprox pads.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Good arm protection for Caving
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I needed some good arm protection for crawling around in caves. I'm quite happy I did, as these things work great for that purpose. I wish I had these when I worked my previous job installing wire in peoples houses which had me crawling around in peoples attics. If you need elbow/arm protection for crawling about, I highly recommend these. Under the conditions I put them through, I don't expect them to last forever, but they are pretty decently sturdy and the price sure bets the others I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Saved my arm!
customer_reviews.text: I have elbow tendon injury which caused severe tendonitis in my arm and being a carpenter , it wasn't healing and my old brace was hurting it. This brace protects it and it starting feeling better after a few days. I wear it 24/7 for now. It may be a coincidence but I'll take any relief... 5 stars ,plus you get two in package.
customer_reviews.author: Netlead

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit which is perfect for 10" circumference at the elbow.
customer_reviews.text: Prior reviews suggested measuring the elbow circumference. Glad I did as I was prepared to order small. Circumference by my elbow is 10" so I ordered size medium which is perfect. I had fractured the bone just below my elbow a couple of weeks ago. The splint was unwieldy and uncomfortable. The sleeve is snug and gives good support. I gave range of motion 5 stars. I can't bend my arm far but that is the support I need.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Singer

customer_reviews.title: Stops my pain......
customer_reviews.text: Okay I did not get this for sports. I have a connective tissue problem that lets all the joints in my body dislocate. Due to the number of dislocations in my left elbow I have several bone spurs. I was looking for anything that would help me protect the elbow from daily bumps, they cause wicked pain. I can use these until the Dr's decide how to repair the elbow, it is a complicated mess. This elbow pad is working well enough I would have paid 3X's the cost if I had known how much difference it would make.
customer_reviews.author: EhlerDave

customer_reviews.title: Not for bursitis.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I recently had a flare up of elbow bursitis. Last time I injured my elbow, my bursitis lasted a year or so. So when I injured it again and it came back, I wanted to get on top of it ASAP. This is not good for bursitis though. When flexing the arm the stiff padding applies inward pressure on the elbow... which is exactly what I was trying to protect against. I found an old elastic elbow sleeve in my garage, which feels 10x better with more support. Find something else for bursitis support. Might be good for other purposes though.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Protection protection
customer_reviews.text: I am way too old to skateboard, but I bought these hoping they would keep me from skinning the same spot on my elbows every time I touched a door jamb while walking through. I take blood thinners and it means easy bruising and bleeding every time I brush against something. I have protective sleeves that I used in the past, but they stop at the elbow, so, when my scab on the elbow is just getting good, I knock it off in another doorway and start all over again. You would not believe how cleared my arms are now after a few weeks of using these protectors, plus I get to look like a cool dude at 72!
customer_reviews.author: Ray S. Hooker

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Crawl Space
customer_reviews.text: I have a two foot high crawl space that requires crawling on your elbows and knees to move about. I have a lot of work to do down there and my elbows were literally raw and bleeding. These pads have been an absolute lifesaver. They stay in place and keep the pads on my elbows where I need them. They were inexpensive and a good value
customer_reviews.author: T. Griebe

customer_reviews.title: Great elbow protection.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome just what I needed to protect my forearm and elbow being in a wheelchair i tend to lean on my arm and elbow and after having fluid drained from my elbow these were just what I needed, I went with a medium and was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I love these pads!
customer_reviews.text: I too, like many others in the reviews, was skeptical about these elbow pads due to the cheap price. I wanted good pads for MTB riding but I didn’t want to pay a fortune since I was just getting into the sport. I am so happy that I took the chance. These elbow pads are so comfortable and non-restrictive that they are perfect for me Mountain Biking. They don’t slip, breathe really well and aren’t bulky at all, they are truly a well made product that I am so glad I purchased! Highly recommend these pads for MTB, Dirt Bike and any other sport that you need good light weight protection that isn’t too hot or bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: These elbow pads are well made as they held up very well to aggressive crawl space work . If these are made one size bigger , I will be buying another pair because this large set is a little snug on me . Customer service wasted no time ensuring my satisfaction . A great price as well .
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: There elbow pads are exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I'm severely disabled by arthritis, and have been struggling with problems using my walker because it causes such pain in my elbows. (I have to lean on the walker because my shoulder can't support me.) These pads have made that so much more simple! I can move them around a little and protect the area below my elbows from the hard plastic handles of the walker. They're comfortable, lightweight, and very reasonably priced. There were a lot of pads to choose from, so I'm very glad I picked these!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Design
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable, compared to the usual elbow padding these are much more ergonomic. They form/fit very well, yet still provide good protection/padding and range of motion. Material appears to be very durable, haven't had them long enough to be sure, will update if necessary. I must also mention that the customer service is grade A1+. I was contacted by them shortly after purchase inquiring if I was satisfied with the product. As you can see, I was. The only issue that I had was that the M size was slightly to big for my puny arms. They immediately responded and provided a solution. Lisa, you rock. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Best pads, and customer service around
customer_reviews.text: The pads are extremely well made. I have already fallen on my new onewheel and they saved my elbows. They are soft on your arms, but firm in the pads. Would suggest not only because of the quality of the product but because I ordered the wrong size, and they sent me a second pair in the correct size which got to me in less than 48 hours! They also stated I should donate the first pair that was the wrong size, because they care about their employees and don't want them handling anything that has been shipped already during Covid19. All around, I will always suggest the bodyprox pads.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Baker

customer_reviews.title: I bought the small and they are perfect size and soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After having an accident on my bicycle I looked for future protection. I took a chance on these elbow sleeve. I just slip them on and I am safer in case of an accident. I am 63 years old and recovery from small injuries take me longer to recover, I feel this is a simple solution to expensive medical bills and pain. I am 5' 4" and weigh 133 pounds. I bought the small and they are perfect size and soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: webbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for paintball
customer_reviews.text: It is worth the price for what I intend to use it for. Materials feels good, thick and Very elastic. It feels tight right now maybe I just need to break it in a bit. So make sure to “measure your arms correctly” otherwise your circulation maybe cut off. Otherwise good buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: rrey

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I got the large and I have fat arms. They were tight but I'm sure after a few wears for skating they will stretch
customer_reviews.author: Kay Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Just what i was looking for. I have upper boby weakness and use my forearms and elbows alot. Skins starting to heal on elbows now. Thanks. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Smatjack

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my workouts. I have to do a lot of planks and other moves where my arms/elbows are touching the floor a lot. So these elbow pads give me good protection. I chose to measure my arm diameter so I would get the correct size and I'm glad I did, rather than just ordering what size I thought I was. I ended up ordering a size medium and it's snug enough for my workouts but not so tight that its uncomfortable. Overall, I recommend these elbow pads.
customer_reviews.author: a.e.

customer_reviews.title: less fear of falling
customer_reviews.text: I walk on an uneven gravel/dirt road and stumbled and fell 2 years ago leaving elbow,knee, and hand an embarrassing bloody mess. I fell again recently with similar results. I am 73 and am hoping to avoid having to explain skinned body parts. These elbow guard fit well and stay in place. They are, however, pretty warm,but I don"t see how that is to be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Peiffer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality elbow protectors
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large elbow protectors for my husband. Pleased with all aspects except for fit. The upper band was a bit too tight and to wear them over a period of time , proved to be uncomfortable. Hoping that in future, the product will be available in x large. Company is very helpful , fast shipping and generally pleased with interactions with them.
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Elbow Pads Work Veru Well
customer_reviews.text: I have sore elbows and tender ulnar nerves causing numbness in my ring and small fingers. I needed pads to protect the elbow and surrounding area from further injury. And these pads fit and work great. I have the medium size for a 5'8 male at 160lbs. These pads work very well under my dress shirts!!
customer_reviews.author: TonyM

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable pads
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these. I use them for mountain biking. I had been wearing nothing so I felt like these would be an improvement. They also give some compression and warmth to the elbows. They are definitely not a replacement for serious pads but if u want a little extra protection that is cheap and comfortable these fit the bill. I was worried they may not fit because I'm a big guy with big arms. I am definitely at the limit but they work.
customer_reviews.author: DTMFM

customer_reviews.title: snug fit
customer_reviews.text: the product came just as described....have not used it to work out with but sometimes my arm just aches and I was told that I have tennis elbow. so if I am sitting and need to go to work I do wear the pad and it does help a lot because i have to use my arms and hands a lot at work. great product....it is a little more snug ordered the biggest size..I am a plus size kind of girl 18w/20w is my size but I do have big arms.you guys might need to do a plus size product too
customer_reviews.author: maisha ellison-safford

customer_reviews.title: XS slipped right off my arm.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to this but unfortunately it doesn’t fit. Bought the smallest size but it just slipped right off my arm. Unless it’s a secure fit, I feel like it’s just going to move around when I ride my mountain bike. Quality was okay. I couldn’t do a test run. Felt like if it had fit, I think I would be okay with this considering it’s like 1/3 cost of others I’m looking at. Make sure you get the right size and measure yourself before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cristeene

customer_reviews.title: Using as a youth hockey coach for elbow protection while on ice
customer_reviews.text: I had been searching around for elbow protection that would easily fit under my coaching jacket. Yes, sometimes coaches call fall too. Hockey elbow pads are way too bulky to fit under a jacket or even a referee sweater. Figured I would give these a try. I used the measurement method suggested and the pads fit perfectly under my jacket. They are comfortable, non restrictive and almost forget I have them on. Finally a useful product for coaches. Thank you. P.S. - I would highly recommend marketing these to Hockey Referees and Coaches.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Tull

customer_reviews.title: Size doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought L size first for snowboard, but it is too big for me. It always loose and goes down from elbow. And then I bought M size, it's too tight!!! It affects circulation so that my hands are numb!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Arm/elbow pads for football
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son, to wear for football. He's a lineman so is usually covered in bruises after a game, all up & down his arms. The bruises on top of bruises were adding up...and hurting. Within a week after wearing the arm/elbow pads, the bruises were down by about 75%. Pretty much the only ones left were above & before the pads. So, they'd get 5 stars if they covered more area. Otherwise, these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Betz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, no pinching, great protection
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and the knee pads for my son's 16th birthday. He's on an airsoft team and he's gone through many sets of pads that either don't fit properly or they wear quickly. My son is a big boy: 6'2" and 260, I worried the large wouldn't fit. He says it's a perfect fit for the knee and elbow pads. They don't pinch, they are flexible without moving around and they offer the best protection. The price for both sets was very reasonable and my son said they get five stars and he would recommend them for any airsofter.
customer_reviews.author: anshpo

customer_reviews.title: Fit snugly and don't slip.  Mild heat buildup.
customer_reviews.text: These pads fit snugly, so they don't slip, and they provide good protection. I use them when I rest my elbows on a hard surface for an extended period rather than for athletic pastimes. There is a mild issue with heat buildup because they cover a lot of arm surface, but I cannot conceive of a better solution for now.
customer_reviews.author: Torrealta

customer_reviews.title: provide excellent protection
customer_reviews.text: I am a female over 60 yrs.of age, and I am in a co-ed exercise class. When I came in wearing these elbow protectors along with the knee protectors the majority of the class wished to know where I purchased these products and the brand name. These I gave to the group, hopefully they will purchase these for they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Lovejoy

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected / Expedited shipping / fits like a glove / I hope it lasts because I really like everything about this elbow protector / even if it doesn’t I would have no problem buying several times over for my business / it’s a in expensive product for the use / I am using to crawl under a home in a crawl space and plan on buying there knee pads / Really a Great product / very comfortable and ease of operation of arm Dru
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Effective Protection
customer_reviews.text: I use these elbow pads to protect them while I type away on the computer. After 30 years as a professional writer, I am facing hand surgery. These pads enable me to continue to work without doing further damage. They are comfortable and do the job as designed. They are well made. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Weil

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm dubious of their ability to protect you. I smacked my elbow on the ground as a test and I felt that as if I was barely wearing anything. But I guess for the price you do get pretty comfortable pads with an okay range of motion and enough protection to save you from the worst of it I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for elbow bursitis
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I have Elbow Bursitis in both elbows. Just tight enough to be comfortable and still be able to work but the padding is crucial to keep from bumping into things or the dreaded leaning on your elbows while you type. Very glad I purchased and the price was right also. MCF
customer_reviews.author: MCF

customer_reviews.title: No more bruises.
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased the knee pads, liked them so much I bought the elbow pads. I can’t say they make me play any better but I can say I’m not as bruised up :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: My elbows are very happy :-)
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I race sailboats and it’s amazing the number of times I have painfully bonked my elbows and gotten massive bruises. These are perfect. They’re not too big but they’re enough to protect, they don’t slide down, they stay in place and do the job. My elbows are very happy :-)
customer_reviews.author: M. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Yet Protective
customer_reviews.text: This product is comfortable, affords me full range of motion of my elbow, and is definitely padded appropriately. I'm pleased with how sturdy and well-made the sleeve is, too. I've already accidentally whacked my injured elbow with this on and I barely felt anything. I would absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AD Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Did not protect me at all.
customer_reviews.text: I had my first crash in these. They did literally nothing to protect my elbows or skin. These are going in the trash, and I am going to purchase some actual elbow pads.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good but in my opinion runs large.
customer_reviews.text: These are good coverage, allowing for flexibility. I would say they are a bit large. I got the smallest option, and they are okay brand new, but I am concerned that they may stretch out quickly, because they aren't super fitted for petite women. Quality is nice though, and seller shipped promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Riley L.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and no slipping
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this for aggressive mountain biking. Got them in medium size, and right away I thought they were too big and would slip. I’m 5’8” with 12” bicep for reference. No slipping how ever. Sturdy fabric and better than expected padding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece of Safety Gear
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to longboarding and ensuring my physical safety was key to me even trying this hobby. These guards work well and they’ve already protected me from several bumps and scrapes, because when learning how to board you will fall. I highly suggest getting a set of these.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: just what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: i use these mountain biking. Not hard core downhill rider, but you can go down anywhere on a root or rocks and bust a knee or elbow! These are just right! They fit snug, but not over tight. Might be hot in summer a bit. I'm 6 1", 175, and slim build. the medium was perfect for me. very well made, good padding, and comfortable fit. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: nicely made
customer_reviews.text: well made and they definately absorb bumps to the elbow. i bought the small because i was between the sizes in inches for small and medium. i wish i had ordered the medium size as the small is a very tight fit. maybe washing will take away some of the tightness. i haven't washed them yet to determine if they shrink or expand afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: ace

customer_reviews.title: Great bike crash protection and also keeps the sun off
customer_reviews.text: I have crashed twice on rocks and roots while mountain biking over the past year. Both times, these pads did not slide and protected my arms really well. I use a size large and I am 6 '1 with thinner arms. They are also really good sun protection for exposed arms.
customer_reviews.author: karthik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stitching - good padding for some purposes
customer_reviews.text: For $14 this product is really, really good. I bought them to use for mountain biking. Although they will protect my elbow if I have a fall, they are not designed for this because I think the material on the padding will rip on gravel. However, the construction looks excellent and for purposes that don’t involve gravel or asphalt I think they would be fabulous. Will update the review if I do have a fall to say how they held up.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Newbery

customer_reviews.title: Great additional dirt-biking protection
customer_reviews.text: I was recently dirt-biking and had a slow speed fall. I was wearing an armored dirt-biking jacket which incorporates hard elbow pads. I was therefore unpleasantly surprised to find that when I fell the elbow pads on the jacket slipped and were pushed back leaving me with bad grazes on both elbows. Its for this reason that I bought the Bodyprox Protection Pads. They are soft and comfortable and fit easily underneath my armored jacket - and after taking a few "sand dives" I find that they don't slip and give me the extra elbow protection that I need. Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Berent

customer_reviews.title: I fw them
customer_reviews.text: Im using these to learn how to skate and like how they feel when i fall no sharp pains. They also feel good under clothes i could move aeound. They arent auper breathable but theyre great for the price. Ive read people complain about having to use them all day but i mean if its just for little bumps and not to kneel on
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband have had 2 surgeries since July 2019, so he needed something to help to protect his arm. He wouldn’t use them for he says it is VERY UNCOMFORTABLE. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Anais Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Good but tight
customer_reviews.text: Good but tight. I was supposed to wear them at night to help a nerve not get pinched but if I wore it at all during the day I couldn't stand it by nighttime. The pads on the elbows however are the best things every I had to wash mine every other day to stay hygentic for food service. One if them had the elbow pad rip off, but I can sew it on a better fitting sleave now. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred R. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A tiny bit uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These stayed in place nicely and were good protection when I needed it, but when I had to keep my elbow bent at a sharper angle, they really got in the way. It’s the understandable nature of elbow pads, but I found them uncomfortable after a while. Not bad if you’re moving more and just need them to protect against minor bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Nickinator

customer_reviews.title: Good for Trails
customer_reviews.text: I wiped out on trail riding and luckily the elbow/knee pads prevented me from getting scrapes. I got a little redden on my knees. Without out the knee and elbows pads for sure scrapes and blood. I wouldn't use it for enduro and downhill rides.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM

customer_reviews.title: I tried them on and I was surprised with how comfortable these felt on my arm
customer_reviews.text: I wish I needed these, but I bought the wrong kind of elbow pads and had to return them. Before I returned them, I tried them on and I was surprised with how comfortable these felt on my arm. They were flexible and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: JazzyJ2817

customer_reviews.title: Seem to Be Exactly What I Need
customer_reviews.text: I have tried them on and the fit is fine (medium for a 5'1" woman--I didn't want them to be extremely snug). I haven't used them yet because I've a unique purpose in mind. When flying I've found that I get bad bruises from the armrests, especially on overnight flights. So, I bought this product to wear when flying. After my next trip, I will add to this review to share how well that plan works.
customer_reviews.author: SEJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Elbow Pads
customer_reviews.text: The materials used in this elbow pads are very sturdy. The pads were comfortable and fit securely on my elbows and forearms. It did not slide or move even while I was sweating heavily. I definitely like these elbow pads. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar Childers

customer_reviews.title: Crawlspace must have.
customer_reviews.text: We had to do an extended job working in a crawl space and the thought of my arms aching sent me looking for a solution. These worked great and made my time under there a lot more comfortable. Have used them for three long days so far and they are holding up great. Make sure you put them on your arms directly and then your tyvek suit over.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M.

customer_reviews.title: Helps protect my elbows as needed .
customer_reviews.text: I have pinched nerves in my elbow so these help when I need to prevent accidentally bumping or over exerting my elbows . Feels great and the padding is very comfortable and sturdy .
customer_reviews.author: MissDenise

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!!
customer_reviews.text: The size I ordered fit. That was awesome, btw. I had surgery and needed to protect my elbow from bumps and these protected my elbow as well as anything. I hope I never need to by them again, but if I do, I'll come and find these pads.
customer_reviews.author: OneBolt

customer_reviews.title: Helped to heal bursitis
customer_reviews.text: I am 64 years old and I recently got Bursitis in my right elbow joint. I had a large fluid filled bulge in my elbow that wasn’t at all painful, just unsightly. I purchased these to provide the compression necessary to force the fluid out of the joint and to protect the joint from further injury. These pads worked perfectly. Within two weeks the bursitis was completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: DAT

customer_reviews.title: Maximum protection!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! I have bone spurs on both elbows with the right elbow being the worst. When ever i bang them on whatever,it's like a funny bone that wont stop! Even the smallest bumps are really painful! These elbow pads add a good level of protection with the raised knobby gel pads, that i don't worry about bumping them and can wear all day at work. Just what i was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because they were cheap in price but they are not cheap in quality. They are perfect for me and what I do. Great for street skating. I will say these aren't for if you want to do large vert ramps though. They work great when falling off rails or if you catch a rock and fall. If you intend to catch big air I would search for something that offers a little more protection. I have crashed pretty good before and after getting these and I absolutely prefer to crash while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and with enough protection
customer_reviews.text: I first got these after a couple of longboarding accidents and I have to say I regret not doing so sooner. At first you'll notice the material is a bit stiff but after a few uses and washes they'll be perfect and ready to go. Do keep in mind that the material is very thick, both the protective part and the one that simply holds everything together so if where you live is hot prepare for a lot of sweat build-up.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Carranza

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well made
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product. My arm is 12.5 inches around the elbow. The size large fits just tight enough to stay in place but with little pressure. Which is what I wanted. If you want the compression fit I would order the medium.
customer_reviews.author: D. Maggard

customer_reviews.title: The best for Bursitis
customer_reviews.text: They got rid of my Bursitis completely.... I use them when I went to bed and daily and they are amazing, wish the material wasn’t so sticky... looks like everything sticks to it like the cotton of the clothes and stuff but other than that is an amazing product! Totally recommended 👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great! I have been mountain bikeing for about 30 years now and just started using pads. These fit well and I forget about them when riding. I had a small crash in a rock garden and it felt like I was landing in pillows = )
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: not good for bursitis if you plan to move your arm a lot :-)
customer_reviews.text: They look and fit great, but this did not work for me at all. I got these elbow pads for a bad case of bursitis and I wanted something to provide some padding for my elbow while training Jiu Jitsu. It was painful, though, since as you straighten and bend your arm, the little foam pads pinch your elbow and this is quite painful if you have bursitis. If you are not planning on moving much and you just need a little bit of padding, perhaps this will work for you. But if you want to train in a sport and have a bad case of bursitis, not so much...
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable after Elbow Surgery
customer_reviews.text: They are great. I had surgery on my elbow and after I was out of my sling I have been wearing it for protection and it works great and is very comfortable. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cscrisson

customer_reviews.title: What we wanted for little league
customer_reviews.text: This fits my 4'4" 55 lb son a little loose. It is a tad long for his arms. It does the job though and gives him some confidence at the plate that the baseball won't hurt him. In all it is exactly what we were looking for which is arm protection while hitting.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for abrasion mostly and some impact protection while riding the One Wheel electric vehicle. I like how comfortable they are and how they fit under a hoodie . My only complaint is that I wish the padded area was a little wider from side to side to protect the outer elbow in a fall. I tend to roll them toward my outer elbow as that is generally where I make contact when I do fall. I have worn these and the matching knee pads 30+ times with a couple falls and the product has help up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 8 yr old daughter. They are a thick but soft material. I turn them upside down so the narrower opening is on her upper arm or else they would fall. She loves them and is willing to wear them so that is a win!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: after being hit by a truck
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my flatmate after he was recovering from a broken arm after being hit by a truck. He loves it and likes that it came with two. He says it really helps with the pain and its comfortable to wear long periods! Yay! A+
customer_reviews.author: Nana The Red

customer_reviews.title: I forgot I was wearing them!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Super cheap, and fantastic quality for the price. The material is supportive and very springy so you have good support, and the padding is relatively soft but still nice and beefy feeling. Like the title said, the two rides I've taken them on so far, I've forgotten they were even on. I haven't crashed in them yet, nor have I had them for a long while, but so far they're an excellent product that I would recommend to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Koval

customer_reviews.title: Check manufacturer’s website to get accurate fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great product to be used for shooting precision rifle from prone position on a shooter’s mat on the ground. Just enough padding/cushion w/o being heavy or bulky. Check manufacturer website to be sure to get good fit. Sizing good on a half-sized shoe so that speaks well. Shoe looks well made but is super lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Incognito elbow protection
customer_reviews.text: Apparently it’s not cool to wear any type of elbow pad when you MTB. This is just a fact. These are cool because they slip beneath your 3/4 jersey and can’t be seen easily by fellow riders at the trailhead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, after my elbow injury of course I hit it on everything possible and wearing this elbow protector keeps it nice and safe. It has a material similar to memory foam inside of it so it’s not tight and it contours to your elbow and arm!
customer_reviews.author: GSXR

customer_reviews.title: Really nice -- just too big for preteens
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice, solid pads I bought for my young teen for futsal. They are really nicely padded, but even the smallest size is too wide to stay on his arms. We will probably keep them because he will grow into them, but they aren't going to work for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: TAZ

customer_reviews.title: Use sizing chart
customer_reviews.text: I liked the quality of the product. But, be sure to use measurement chart. I heeded the advice of a review that they may run a bit bigger than normal, and they ended up being too small! I would have tried the large next time. I gave it away, and will probably get larger size.
customer_reviews.author: nbaez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, protective elbow guards, but tight
customer_reviews.text: Seem very well made. Nicely padded. I went with their measurements and I was in the Large range, however it is quite a bit tight. I don’t think these will loosen up over time. It’s worse on flexion.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a sensitive nerve on my elbow. It became very hard for me to lean on my elbow without lots of pain. This provides great cushion, and it’s pretty comfy too. I wish it had slightly less compression to it, but I probably could’ve gotten a size bigger to fix that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paige_

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: They protect your elbows well enough (i wear them under my jacket when snowboarding), but they do inhibit mobility and aren't the most comfortable. If you want comfort then maybe try g-form (their knee pads are comfy at least  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄)
customer_reviews.author: Jagvir

customer_reviews.title: Fits and is comfortable. However...
customer_reviews.text: The protection layer of raised padding could be wider to offer a greater area of protection. Also, it covers the elbow plus a couple of inches on either side. Can't cover upper arm or middle wrist area.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeylair

customer_reviews.title: Bodyprox Protection Pads
customer_reviews.text: I officiate High School Baseball and get hit every once in a while. I was looking for something to make it a little safer for me. I found this, Bodyprox Elbow Protection Pads. Not to hot and very comfortable to wear. Great product..
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace an old set of elbow pads while I ref hockey. These are perfect! Not bulky and don't constrict while providing enough protection. I will stick with my hockey elbow pads while playing but use these for reffing or coaching. I was in between getting a medium and a large according to the sizing chart. I went with the large and I'm glad I did. They seem to fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice van der Sluys

product_meta.title: Bodyprox Elbow Protection Pads 1 Pair, Elbow Guard Sleeve
feature_bullets: UNPARALLELED PROTECTION. Structured with a strategically placed foam grid, which provides average relief from all sorts of ailments affecting the elbow area including joint inflammation, tendonitis, golf elbow, tennis elbow, and other elbow pain. This elbow pads are exceptional injury prevention methods while enabling the user to properly approach any activity.

INCREDIBLY STRATEGIC FABRICATION. Made from abrasion-resistant materials with foam padding in order to provide reliable and fail-safe support for activities requiring strenuous arm movement, including Golf, Tennis, Baseball, Crossfit, Basketball, Weightlifting, Powerlifting, and/or Volleyball. Confidently enjoy these activities with remarkable elbow support while still maintaining your peak performance and full range of arm motion.

ABSOLUTE SNUG FIT. Designed tactically with foam padding on a breathable compression fabric for superior and optimum comfort, support, and relief without undermining and compromising your mobility. The snug fit of the material maintains joint stability regardless of the activity at hand may it be light or strenuous.

COMES IN A PAIR. Support both elbows by acquiring a pair of this durable elbow pads. Made to withstand machine washing and drying without deforming the foam pads. Suitable for both male and female. Perfect for people of all ages and fitness levels. Wear it everyday.

ONE SIZE DOES NOT FIT ALL. To ensure neither of comfort, protection nor mobility are compromised, please take the time to measure before purchasing: Small (7.5-10”), Medium (10-12”), Large (12-14”). With Bodyprox, do your usual thing outdoors unworried!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
